NOTE: This package is supporsed to work in [acepad](https://github.com/hoge1e3/acepad-dev), not a regular node envronment.

# @acepad/widget

A widget(GUI) system for the Acepad editor that supports rendering iframes, overlay components, and dynamically interactive UI blocks inside the editor layout.

## functions 

- showIframe(url_or_file, options)
   - shows url or file(in html) as a widget.
   - options
     - `global`: global variables(in plain object) to be set iframe.contentWindow
     - `pNode`: set true to load petit-node into the iframe.
- show(dom, options)
   - Shows widget
   - `dom`: optional. Element to be used as the widget.
   - `options`:
      - `width`: Specify width in percent(100 for full width), default is 100.
      - `buttons`: Configure buttons on title bar.
         - Array of `{command: , caption: }` where `command` is either "close", "minify" or custom function
      - `noMenu`: do not show minified icon.
      - `fullscreen`: Set true and show over screen keyboard
      - `overlay`: Set true and enable auto overlay editor for each `<input>` or `<textarea>` elements in the widget. Overlay editor allows input via acepad screen keyboard. 
   - returns
      - `element` The element used as this widget 
      - `close` Close the widget
      - `minify` Minify the widget
      - `print(dom)` Put `dom` element into the widget. If the element of same id exists. The element is 'overwritten' by preserving original DOM tree and events as possible. See `examples/print.js` 
- See `types.d.ts` for full TypeScript definitions.

## Features
- Embed iframe panels with custom URLs and live content
- Minimize, close, and manage widgets from the toolbar
- Dynamic DOM updating and data binding via `.print`
- Optional overlay activation for Smartphone input.
